notes.text:
This update for libxkbcommon fixes the following issues:

Fixed multiple memory handling and correctness issues (bsc#1105832):

- CVE-2018-15859
- CVE-2018-15856
- CVE-2018-15858
- CVE-2018-15864
- CVE-2018-15863
- CVE-2018-15862
- CVE-2018-15861
- CVE-2018-15855
- CVE-2018-15854
- CVE-2018-15857
- CVE-2018-15853

notes.text: Endless recursion exists in xkbcomp/expr.c in xkbcommon and libxkbcommon before 0.8.1, which could be used by local attackers to crash xkbcommon users by supplying a crafted keymap file that triggers boolean negation.

notes.text: Unchecked NULL pointer usage in xkbcommon before 0.8.1 could be used by local attackers to crash (NULL pointer dereference) the xkbcommon parser by supplying a crafted keymap file, because geometry tokens were desupported incorrectly.

notes.text: Unchecked NULL pointer usage in resolve_keysym in xkbcomp/parser.y in xkbcommon before 0.8.2 could be used by local attackers to crash (NULL pointer dereference) the xkbcommon parser by supplying a crafted keymap file, because a map access attempt can occur for a map that was never created.
